intro: Impatiens lauterbachii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its compact size and long blooming period make it a favored ornamental plant in both gardens and homes.
